title: How to Post Images in a Discord Chat on a PC or Mac

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. Discord is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux. [1] X Research source You can also use Discord in your browser at https://discord.com/ .

steps.title: Navigate to a server or Direct Message.
steps.content: Navigate to a server or Direct Message. Click a server from the left panel, or click a recent Direct Message to open it. You can start a server or join one. If you're posting an image to a server that isn't yours, you must have permission to upload files. If you don't, you won't be able to upload the image.

steps.title: Drag and drop an image into the Discord window.
steps.content: Drag and drop an image into the Discord window. This is easiest when the file is nearby, such as in another open window or on your desktop. [2] X Research source To manually upload a photo from your files: Double-click the + icon in the chat field. Locate the image you want to send and select it. Click Open . Images must be 25 MB or smaller. If you have Discord Nitro , you'll have a higher upload limit.

steps.title: Add a spoiler tag or modification (optional).
steps.content: Add a spoiler tag or modification (optional). If the image has content that others may not want to see or may need a warning, click the eyeball icon in the top-right corner of the image. This will blur the image until the user clicks it. To change the file name, click the pencil icon. Delete the existing file name and enter a new one. Click Save when finished. To add alt text, click the pencil icon. Add a description in the Alt Text field. Click Save when finished. To delete the photo from your draft, click the red trash can icon.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . This will send your image to the server or recipient. If needed, you can delete messages on Discord after they've been sent.
